text.13_Daf, 9_Line, 0_Comment: We must say that it means that there is no Melachah forbidden on Shabbos that is not forbidden on Yom Tov, except for Ochel Nefesh.
text.13_Daf, 9_Line, 1_Comment: However, there are other distinctions between them. This (Shabbos) has Misah (for one who does Melachah), and this (Yom Tov) is a Lav.
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 0_Comment: (SUMMARY: Tosfos discusses the inference that Ochel Nefesh is permitted even if it was possible before Yom Tov.)
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 1_Comment: משמע מדלא פליגי אלא במכשירין מכלל דגוף המאכל שרי לעשות ביום טוב אע"ג דאפשר לעשות מערב יו"ט
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 3_Comment: INFERENCE: Since they argue only about Machshirin, this implies that one may make the food itself on Yom Tov, even though it was possible from Erev Yom Tov.
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 4_Comment: ומדרבי יהודה נשמע לרבנן דהא לא פליגי עליה אלא במכשירין
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 6_Comment: We learn from R. Yehudah to Rabanan. They argue with him only about Machshirin.
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 7_Comment: וא"כ קשיא דאמר בפרק המצניע (שבת דף צה. ושם) החולב והמגבן והמחבץ והרודה חלות דבש בשבת חייב חטאת הזיד ביו"ט לוקה את הארבעים
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 9_Comment: QUESTION - CITATION (SHABBOS 95A): If one milked, curdled milk or made cheese or removed cakes of honey from a hive, on Shabbos b'Shogeg, he is Chayav Chatas. If he did so on Yom Tov b'Mezid, he gets 40 lashes.
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 12_Comment: This is Ochel Nefesh! (The Torah permits it on Yom Tov.)
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 13_Comment: ואפי' לרבנן דאמרי התם אחד זה ואחד זה אין בו אלא משום שבות
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 15_Comment: IMPLIED SUGGESTION: [Our Tana'im hold like] Rabanan, who say there that both of these (i.e. on Shabbos and Yom Tov) are forbidden only mid'Rabanan.
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 16_Comment: מ"מ מודו היכא דאיכא אב מלאכה דלוקה
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 18_Comment: REJECTION: Chachamim agree that one is lashed for an Av Melachah!
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 19_Comment: ויש לומר דודאי אוכל נפש המתקלקל אם עושהו מאתמול מותר לעשות ביו"ט
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 21_Comment: ANSWER: Surely, Ochel Nefesh that would spoil if one did it yesterday (before Yom Tov) one may do it on Yom Tov;
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 22_Comment: אבל אוכל נפש דעדיף טפי כשהוא עשוי מאתמול כגון ההוא דהמצניע אסור לעשותו ביו"ט
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 24_Comment: However, Ochel Nefesh that is better when it is done from yesterday, e.g. the case in Shabbos 95a, one may not do it on Yom Tov;
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 25_Comment: אבל מכשירין דלא מתקלקל כשנעשו מאתמול בהא ודאי יש לחלק [בין] היכא דאפשר ללא אפשר.
text.13_Daf, 14_Line, 27_Comment: However, Machshirin, which do not spoil when they are done from yesterday, surely we distinguish between when it was possible [before Yom Tov] and when it was not!
